intro: Parakeelya quadrivalvis, commonly known as the four-valved parakeelya, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique four-valved fruits. The plant produces showy, palmate leaves and vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
